{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1991 |Team=Wyoming Cowboys |Image= |ImageSize = |Conference=Western Athletic Conference |Division= |ShortConference=WAC |Record=4-6-1 |ConfRecord= |CoachRank= |APRank= |HeadCoach=[[Joe Tiller]] |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |Stadium=[[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]] |Champion= |BowlTourney= |BowlTourneyResult= }} {{1991 WAC football standings}} The Wyoming Cowboys represented the [[University of Wyoming]] in the 1991 NCAA Football season. Joe Tiller was in his first year as head coach of the Cowboys. The offense scored 305 points, while the defense allowed 357 points. It was the second losing season in three seasons for the Cowboys. The Cowboys played their home games at [[War Memorial Stadium (Wyoming)|War Memorial Stadium]]. At seasonâs end, the Cowboys were not ranked in the National Rankings.
==Regular season== *In the battle for the [[Bronze Boot]], the Cowboys beat the Colorado State Rams by a score of 35-28. It was the fifteenth time that the Cowboys won the Bronze Boot.<ref>http://www.wyomingathletics.com/trads/bronzeboot.html</ref>
